diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Cushing’s syndrome, probably caused by a corticotropin-secreting pulmonary nodule.
differential_diagnosis: Autoimmune diabetes (latent autoimmune diabetes in adults)
Ectopic Cushing’s syndrome, probably from a pulmonary carcinoid tumor
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient's presentation included worsening diabetes despite treatment, proximal-muscle weakness, and facial edema. Diagnostic tests confirmed hypercortisolism, leading to a diagnosis of ectopic Cushing’s syndrome associated with the enlarging pulmonary nodule.
